[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/views.rs] [Trait: TypeView] [Type confusion] Can an attacker implement TypeView incorrectly to return misleading TypeTags that bypass type safety checks in the Move VM, potentially allowing unauthorized resource access or type confusion attacks? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/views.rs] [Trait: TypeView::to_type_tag()] [Type spoofing] Could a malicious implementation of to_type_tag() return a TypeTag for a privileged system type (like Coin or Account), allowing unauthorized operations on protected resources? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/views.rs] [Trait: ValueView] [Gas manipulation] Can an attacker craft malicious ValueView implementations that underreport memory size in visit() to bypass gas metering and cause resource exhaustion on validator nodes? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/views.rs] [Function: ValueView::visit()] [Recursion DoS] Does the visit() method have recursion depth limits, or can deeply nested structures cause stack overflow when traversing values, halting validator execution? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/views.rs] [Function: ValueView::visit()] [Error handling bypass] Can a malicious visitor implementation return Err() at strategic points to abort gas metering mid-calculation, resulting in incorrect gas charges? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/views.rs] [Function: ValueView::legacy_abstract_memory_size()] [Gas underflow] Can the legacy_abstract_memory_size() calculation underflow when processing certain value types, resulting in zero or minimal gas charges for expensive operations? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/views.rs] [Function: ValueView::legacy_abstract_memory_size()] [Integer overflow] Can accumulated AbstractMemorySize values overflow during addition operations in the Acc visitor, wrapping around to small values and bypassing gas limits? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/views.rs] [Constant: LEGACY_CONST_SIZE] [Gas manipulation] Is the LEGACY_CONST_SIZE of 16 bytes appropriate for all primitive types, or can attackers exploit this fixed size for u8/bool values to cause gas miscalculation? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/views.rs] [Constant: LEGACY_REFERENCE_SIZE] [Reference gas bypass] Can attackers create deeply nested reference chains where each reference only costs 8 bytes, resulting in severely undercharged gas for complex reference structures? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/views.rs] [Constant: LEGACY_STRUCT_SIZE] [Struct gas undercharge] Does the fixed 2-byte LEGACY_STRUCT_SIZE properly account for struct overhead, or can large structs with many fields be severely undercharged, enabling gas DoS attacks? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/views.rs] [Constant: LEGACY_CLOSURE_SIZE] [Closure gas manipulation] Is the 6-byte LEGACY_CLOSURE_SIZE sufficient for all closure types, or can complex closures with large captured environments bypass proper gas accounting? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/views.rs] [Lines 204-208] [Panic handling] The expect() call on line 206 states 'Legacy function: should not fail' - but can malicious implementations still cause panics here, crashing validator nodes? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/views.rs] [Function: ValueVisitor::visit_delayed()] [Delayed field bypass] Can attackers exploit visit_delayed() with malicious DelayedFieldID values to bypass gas metering, since the Acc implementation returns Ok(()) without charging? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/views.rs] [Function: ValueVisitor::visit_delayed()] [Missing implementation] The TODO comment on lines 51-53 indicates incomplete implementation - can this be exploited to create free delayed fields without proper gas accounting? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/views.rs] [Function: ValueVisitor::visit_delayed()] [Depth tracking bypass] Does visit_delayed() properly validate the depth parameter, or can attackers supply artificially low depths to bypass recursion limits? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/views.rs] [Function: ValueVisitor::visit_u8()] [Gas consistency] Are all integer types (u8, u16, u32, u64, u128, u256) charged the same LEGACY_CONST_SIZE despite vastly different actual sizes, enabling gas manipulation? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/views.rs] [Function: ValueVisitor::visit_u256()] [Large integer bypass] Does visit_u256() properly account for the 32-byte size of U256 values, or does the 16-byte LEGACY_CONST_SIZE severely undercharge large integer operations? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/views.rs] [Function: ValueVisitor::visit_i8() through visit_i256()] [Signed integer handling] Are signed integer types properly validated for valid ranges, or can out-of-range signed values cause undefined behavior in gas calculations? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/views.rs] [Function: ValueVisitor::visit_bool()] [Boolean validation] Does visit_bool() validate that bool values are actually 0 or 1, or can invalid boolean representations bypass validation and cause state corruption? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/views.rs] [Function: ValueVisitor::visit_address()] [Address length validation] Does visit_address() properly validate AccountAddress::LENGTH, or can oversized/undersized addresses bypass gas metering and security checks? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/views.rs] [Function: ValueVisitor::visit_struct()] [Struct recursion] Can attackers create self-referential or mutually recursive structs that cause infinite loops in visit_struct(), hanging validator nodes? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/views.rs] [Function: ValueVisitor::visit_struct()] [Field count manipulation] Does visit_struct() properly validate the len parameter, or can attackers supply incorrect lengths to bypass gas charges for struct fields? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/views.rs] [Function: ValueVisitor::visit_struct()] [Return value abuse] The function returns bool - can malicious implementations return false to skip recursion into fields, bypassing gas metering? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/views.rs] [Function: ValueVisitor::visit_closure()] [Closure environment bypass] Does visit_closure() properly account for captured environment variables, or can large closures with many captures be severely undercharged? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/views.rs] [Function: ValueVisitor::visit_vec()] [Vector size manipulation] Can attackers supply incorrect len values to visit_vec() to misrepresent vector sizes and bypass gas charges? (High)
